revision.text:
{{Infobox military unit |unit_name= 627th Radar Squadron |image= [[File:627th Radar Squadron - Emblem.png|250px]] |caption= Emblem of the 627th Radar Squadron |dates= 1957-1968 |country= United States |allegiance= |branch= {{air force|USA}} |type= General Radar Surveillance |role= |size= |command_structure= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |colonel_of_the_regiment= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles= |anniversaries= |decorations= }} The '''627th Radar Squadron''' is an inactive [[United States Air Force]] unit. It was last assigned to the [[32d Air Division]], [[Air Defense Command]] (ADC), stationed at [[Crystal Springs Air Force Station]], Mississippi. It was inactivated on 8 September 1968.
The squadron was originally activated in 1946<ref>''see'' [http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/097/755.xml Abstract, History of 529th AC& W Gp, Jul 1946-Dec 1946] (accessed 1 Apr 2012)</ref> as one of the first Aircraft Control & Warning Squadrons (AC&W Sq) when the [[Army Air Forces]] assumed the radar detaction mission from the [[Signal Corps (United States Army)|Signal Corps]] in 1946. Its mission was to provide air defense for the island of [[Guam]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2012}} It was inactivated when its parent group moved from Guam to Okinawa.<ref>[http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/043/218.xml Abstract, History of 627th AC&W Sq, Mar 1948-Jun 1948)] (accessed 1 Apr 2012)</ref>
The unit was reactivated in 1957<ref name="cj 154">Cornett & Johnson, p. 154 (Cornett & Johnson do not provide exact dates for the squadron's period at Dobbins AFB)</ref> as a General Surveillance Radar unit under ADC, providing for the air defense of the Gulf Coast of North America, although it was apparently only a paper unit without personnel or equipment until moving to its programmed site in Mississippi.{{Citation needed|date=April 2012}} In 1958, the squadron provided support to contractors participating in the radar frequency diversity test program.<ref>[http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/413/943.xml Abstract, History of 627th AC&W Sq, Jul 1958-Sep 1959] (accessed 1 Apr 2012)</ref> In 1959, the squadron joined the [[Semi Automatic Ground Environment]] system and was redesignated as a Radar Squadron.<ref name="cj 154"/> It was discontinued and inactivated in 1968, when the [[United States Department of Defense|Department of Defense]] decided to draw down air defenses in the Gulf Coast region.<ref>''see'' Leonard, p. 173 for the need to rebuild these defenses in 1972.</ref>
==Lineage== * Constituted as the '''[[627th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron]]''', ''ca''. June 1946 : Activated ''ca'' 18 July 1946 : Inactivated on 22 June 1948 : Activated on 8 April 1957 : Redesignated '''627th Radar Squadron''' (SAGE) on 1 October 1959 : Discontinued and inactivated on 8 September 1968
'''Assignments''' * Probably 529th Aircraft Control and Warning Group, 18 July 1946 - 22 June 1948 * [[35th Air Division]], 1 September 1957<ref name="cj 154"/> * 32d Air Division, 15 November 1958<ref name="cj 154"/> * [[Montgomery Air Defense Sector]], 1 November 1959<ref name="cj 154"/> * 32d Air Division, 1 April 1966 â€“ 8 September 1968<ref name="cj 154"/>
'''Stations''' * [[Northwest Guam Air Force Base]], Guam, ''ca'' 18 July 1946 - 20 March 1948<ref>[http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/043/216.xml Abstract, History of 627 AC&W Sq CY 1947] (accessed 1 Apr 2012)</ref><ref name="627 m-j 48">[http://www.airforcehistoryindex.org/data/000/043/217.xml Abstract, History of 627th AC&W Sq, Jan 1948-Mar 1948] (accessed 1 Apr 2012)</ref> * [[Harmon AFB]], Guam, 20 March 1948 - 22 June 1948<ref name="627 m-j 48"/> * [[Dobbins AFB]], Georgia, 8 April 1957 - 1 September 1958<ref name="cj 154"/> * [[Crystal Springs AFS]], Mississippi, 1 September 1958 - 8 September 1968<ref name="cj 154"/>
